name: Polo Towers Suites

reviews.text: I like to write reviews of the places we have stayed in order for others to read before booking a trip because I read TA for the same reason.
reviews.title: Nice 2 BD Suite

reviews.text: We booked 3 nights-4 days at the Polo Towers using my parents timeshare. My mother was celebrating her 67th birthday. The Polo Towers are very clean and the staff were also very nice. I'm not a fan of the location but once the City Center is completed and hopefully they get rid to the 2 strip malls out front, the place would be much better. The strip malls out front attract an undesirable crowd but we just didn't let it bother us too much since we drove most of the time.
reviews.title: Viva LV

reviews.text: We had a 2 bedroom suite which is actually a 1 bedroom suite with an attached jr. suite for the 2nd bedroom. We were given a room overlooking the strip on the 14th floor right near the elevator. (We were exciting that we didn't have to walk the south 40 from the elevator). The rooms were one of the remodeled rooms and the decor was really nice with granite counter tops, and the colors were rich golds and browns. My parents stayed in the 1 bedroom suite side and my husband and I stayed in the jr. suite side. The jr. suite side had a separate entrance, small kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker, sink, and refrigerator. Bring your own coffee as they only provide one small sampler for your coffee maker. Also we had a hugh balconey and a hugh shower. There was only one sink and with the hugh shower the bath was small. (I wouldn't recommend a long term stay in just the jr. suite since it is a little small but with the attached 1 bedroom it was a hugh apartment).
reviews.title: Excellent Location

likes.liked: — It's very central location on the strip

reviews.text: The 1 bedroom suite had a full kitchen with everything including a full size refrigerator and dishwasher. All utensils, plates, cups, etc are included. They provide shuttle service to the grocery store if you don't have a car.
reviews.title: Great Place For Us - December 22-29

likes.liked: — Being on the Las Vegas strip, but still being able to get away from it all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all the Polo Towers were nice (didn't check out the pool areas). It was a comfortable stay and I would stay again.
reviews.title: A good quiet vacation

reviews.text: We stayed in the Polo Towers Villa during the week of April 18th. We had a two bedroom / two bathroom unit that we booked through our timeshare exchange with Interval International. I was a bit apprehensive beforehand due to some of the TripAdvisor reviews but could not have been more pleased once we arrived. It was wonderful!
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved the Polo Tower Villas!

likes.liked: — The villas were top-notch and the location cannot be beat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our unit was just beautiful. My husband and I took my parents and there was plenty of room for the four of us. One bathroom had a Jacuzzi tub. The other had a large walk-in shower. My parents’ bedroom had a king-sized bed. Ours had a pull-down queen-sized Murphy bed, which we left down for the entire trip. (There was no sense in putting it back each day since we had a couch in the living room to use.) We were on the second floor and didn’t have much of a view, but we hardly noticed. The towels were replenished daily and the beds were made.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay..

likes.disliked: — No casino, no bar, no entertainment & loud music from Marketplace

reviews.text: The gorgeous full kitchen was great for making coffee in the morning and storing snacks. We easily could have cooked but we chose not to. The small convenience store on site was helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location! Overall not great experience!
Great Stay!
reviews.text: Perhaps the best thing about the Polo Tower is its location. It’s smack in the middle of the strip. We had an easy time getting to all of the casinos. Regarding cabs, there were a few times where we had to get the front desk to call one for us but they always showed up quickly. I have no idea why prior reviews complain so much about the cab situation.
We did not use the rooftop pool but would have if the weather had been better. While it’s not a luxurious pool, it’s certainly adequate.
reviews.title: Our 5th stay at Polo
Great location
reviews.text: I stayed with three friends in a one bedroom suite. The living room had a queen murphy bed, the bedroom had a king. The decor was really nice, the room was equiped with everything we needed when we weren't out doing the Vegas stuff. The bathroom was big, two sinks, one on each side of the bathroom so plenty of room for four to spread our stuff out. The place was very clean, had a great convenience store and very helpful concierge service. You can get a cheap shuttle to and from the airport, no line when I was there!

We have a Marriott timeshare, so we decided to take a trip to Las Vegas. The travel agent that helped us told us he reserved us a room at a Marriott timeshare affiliate. We called back to confirm, and realized he never reserved the room at all. So because of the short notice, we were stuck with the Polo Towers. I've never in my life stayed at such a horrible, lousy excuse for a hotel. When we checked in, they said that we had to wait to check in b/c it wasn't 4pm yet. We came back at 4:30, and they said that they can only give us one of our two rooms b/c the other room was being cleaned. They called us back and said that the maid service was actually closed and couldn't get us the 2nd room next to us (that they promised) but could put us on another floor. After about an hour of speaking with incompetent hotel employees, we finally were able to check into our 2nd room. How does the maid service close half an hour after check in time?
reviews.title: The Worst Place I've Ever Stayed

reviews.text: The rooms were disgusting and old. I felt like we walked into a pastel nightmare. The "design", the color scheme, the old, worn carpet...I could go on and on and on...but let's move on to the pool. Disgusting & Dirty. The walls? They were way too thin, and unfortunately, we could hear our neighbors. I could go on and on and on.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay

reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend it. Ever. To anyone. This is not a 3-star hotel. It's maybe at 2 stars...
reviews.title: Villas were Fine

likes.disliked: — entrance hard to fine if driving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four of us stayed in a 2-bedroom suite. It was ideally set up perfectely for us. My wife brother and his wife had a totally seperate entrance with their own keys to enter from the outside hallway, and we had our own keys to enter the main suite which led us into the living room, full kitchen and the main bedroom with a king size bed and a full wash room with double sink. There was a small hall way which then took us into the second bedroom which had a small kitchenette, a very large shower and a balconey with a murphy bed.(pull down from the wall). The room was very clean, with all new furnitures and a fully equipted kitchen. We had daily light maid service (made beds, change towels, and garbage removal). On the fourth day they change all the bed linens, vacuum, wash dishes along with the other daily service.Polo Towers is ideally located on the Strip, close to everything that one would want to do in Las Vegas. Check in took no more than 5 minutes and because our room was ready we were able to go in early. The roof top pool was excellent with a hot tob and two gas Bar-B-Q which is available for your use. We prepare supper on the Bar-B-Q one evening and immediately it was cleaned by their staff. The only problem I had was the A/C fan in the main bedroom was noisy, but after informing the front desk, it was attented immediately.
reviews.title: polo towers nasty room

reviews.text: Even if you book through a hotel booking site, you may or may not be renting someone's time-share unit.
reviews.title: Your room depends on who owns in...

reviews.text: In our case, we were renting a time-share unit, which was totally fine by us.
reviews.title: Disappointing Polo Towers
Beautiful Rooms- Center Strip
reviews.text: The rate was reasonable, and the location was fine - not right on the strip, but just off.

It was a studio with Murphy Bed. With the bed up, there were some cushions that formed a couch for seating 2-3 people. With the bed down, well, seating was on the bed. Room was quite small but we knew that going in - suitable for maximum 2 persons. You could squeeze 3 people on the bed and have a 4th sleep on the pile of cushions on the floor (as we did one night when a couple friends surprised us), but it's definitely not recommended (and may violate your agreement).
reviews.title: Very Good Experience

reviews.text: Nice balcony with views (though view depends on what side you're on).
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else!

likes.disliked: — Everything else, it was nasty and run down.

aka: Polo Towers Villas Hotel Las Vegas
description: The best way to experience Las Vegas is to stay in the heart of the action. There is only one boulevard where you can find non-stop action and excitement here, and that's the world famous Las Vegas Strip. There is only one resort where you can find classic elegance and casual comfort during a stay in Las Vegas, and that's at Polo Towers Suites. Las Vegas is a destination spot for travelers from around the world who come to experience the sights, sounds, casino action, top notch shows, superior shopping, dining, golfing and even family fun-filled adventures. You, too, can plan a trip that will be as remarkable as it is memorable. A Peek at Polo Towers Suites Located in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip, Polo Towers Suites promises and delivers the best accommodations. You will enjoy the lavish resort-style amenities within your room and on the exterior as well. From the pool to the fitness center, you will find ways to stay active, or simply unwind. Get the best service from the staff and the most useful information about the area from our Concierge. You may even want to pamper yourself at the spa or with the personal massage services. You will have everything you need in your magnificent suite. Style, elegance and comfort await you and your family. The spacious rooms will be the perfect place for you to kick back after a day of shopping or evening of gambling. Alternatively, you may want to simply take in the spectacular evening views of the lights of Las Vegas from your secluded balcony or terrace. Not to mention, you will enjoy easy access to world-class casinos, shopping, entertainment and attractions. Hitting the Town Las Vegas Style Enjoy the luxury of coming and going as you please, to one of the world's best action packed, scenic cities. There is never a shortage of things to see and do, and you will be right in the middle of it all. Take comfort in knowing you can spend the day shopping and return your purchases to your room, with ease, before heading out for the evening. You can enjoy dining at the best restaurants, gambling at the most famous casinos or taking in shows from some of the most famous names in the business. Our Concierge will help you arrange whatever you want, whether it is a night on the town or a family outing. With Polo Towers Suites, you won't be taking a gamble when it comes to finding the best resort to plan your trip around.
